text:
Taiwanese beef rolls make an
amazing and tasty appetizer.

And in Mandarin, we call
these [SPEAKING MANDARIN].

They're filled with tender
braised beef, freshly

sliced cucumbers, and
sweet hoisin sauce.

And just talking about
them makes me super hungry.

So let's jump right in,
because I haven't had lunch,

and I'll show you guys
how to make this delicious
Taiwanese snack.

For the ingredients,
I've gone ahead

to prepare some green
onion pancakes, some slices

of my Taiwanese
braised beef shank,

and if you need
recipes for these,

I'll leave links in
the video description.

We will also need some
thinly sliced cucumbers,

fresh cilantro, and
some hoisin sauce.

To make the rolls,
it's super easy.

Just take a cooked
green onion pancake,

spread a thin layer of
hoisin sauce to taste,

add some cucumbers, some
slices of the braised beef,

and of course, I like
to add lots and lots

of fresh cilantro, because I
love the taste of cilantro.

Also, for extra
presentation points,

you can add some
stalks of cilantro

peeking out from opposite
ends of the pancake.

Next, carefully roll
the pancake and cut

into smaller appetizer-sized
pieces before serving.

So that's how you make these
yummy Taiwanese beef rolls.

And as you can see,
they were super fun
and easy to put together.

And because it's lunch time,
and I haven't had lunch yet,
let's get to the taste test.

I love the flavors
of the braised beef

along with the cilantro and the
crunchiness of the cucumbers.

It's sweet, savory,
and I love, love,

love how it's inside a
flaky green onion pancake
kind of roll.

Super delicious and
highly recommend.

I'm Angel, I hope you
guys enjoy this video.

Give me a thumbs up if you
guys are a fan of beef rolls,

and post in the
comments below and let

me know, where was the
last place you guys had
Taiwanese beef rolls?

Was it in Taiwan, or maybe
a restaurant in the US?

I want to know where you
guys get your beef roll fix.

And who knows, maybe
next time, you'll
be making this recipe at home.

As always, thank you guys
so much for watching,
and I will see you guys soon.
Bye.

Do I have hoisin
sauce on my face?
